required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Circulating circRNA in Acute Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Significance of Circulating circRNA in Acute Ischemic Stroke (CRAST)

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Hospital of Xuzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: CRAST is to analyze the expression pattern of circular RNA (circRNA) by bioinformatics analysis in patients with acute ischemic stroke and healthy control. The candidate circRNA will be verified as biomarkers for the detection and prognosis of acute ischemic stroke.

detailed_description.textblock: Circular RNAs have been highlighted to be involved in the pathological process of ischemic stroke (IS). The purpose of this protocol will investigate the expression pattern of circular RNA (circRNA) by bioinformatics analysis in patients with acute ischemic stroke and healthy control. The candidate circRNA will be verified as biomarkers for the detection and prognosis of acute ischemic stroke. Distinctive expression patterns of circRNA will be identified by individual quantitative real time polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR). A diagnostic or predictive model will be established using logistic regression. The panel of these altered circRNAs may be associated with acute IS and could serve as a novel diagnostic or predictive method.

primary_outcome.description: Differential expression pattern of circular RNA (circRNA) will be compared between AIS group and HC group, thus candidate circRNA will be verified as biomarkers for the detection and prognosis of AIS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dynamic changes of circRNA during the follow-up period
secondary_outcome.description: Dynamic changes of circRNA will be explored before and after endovascular therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of circRNA and stroke-associated infection
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of circRNA and stroke-associated infection will be explored in acute ischemic stroke.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of circRNA and inflammatory factors in acute ischemic stroke
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of circRNA and inflammatory factors on admission will be explored in acute ischemic stroke.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prognostic value of circRNA in acute ischemic stroke
secondary_outcome.description: The prognosis of AIS patients will be analyzed between differential expressed candidate circRNA after they have completed the systematic therapy.

arm_group.description: This group includes patients with acute ischemic stroke (AIS).

intervention.description: Quantitative Real-time polymerase chain reaction of circular RNA (circRNA).

biospec_descr.textblock: An 10 ml peripheral venous blood will be collected from the participants before and after interventions (i.e. intravenous thrombolysis and/or endovascular therapy)

study_pop.textblock: There will be 100 patients suspected of AIS (such as transient ischemic attack), 300 AIS patients and 100 Healthy controlsï¼Œwhose data will be applied for construction and validation of diagnostic and predictive models of circRNA from the circulating blood.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18 years or older
- Confirmed acute ischemic stroke by a diffusion-weighted imaging-position lesion on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and a new lesion on a brain computed tomography (CT) scan
- Within 72 hours of symptom onset
- Good performance status
- Signed an approved informed consents
Exclusion Criteria:
- a history of hemorrhagic infarction, chronic kidney/liver diseases, peripheral arterial occlusive disease, active malignant disease, and inflammatory or infectious diseases
